myMode Configure Audio Interfaces and Streaming Modes
[Application Building Blocks]

Detailed Description

A Mode is a configuration of DICE audio interfaces, routings, and clock rates.


The current mode settings are used by DiceDriver on the Host to configure to match.

HOW TO ADD MORE MODES

1) Create a myMode<n>.c file, use one of the existing as template
2) Make the changes and REMEMBER to replace modeCfg<oldn> with modeCfg<n>
3) Increment MYMODES_NBMODES below
4) In myModes .c add extern declaration of modeCfg<n> and add to modeDesc
5) In main makefile add new c file
6) Make
